message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about condensation. When you see little wet spots on your windshield, it indicates that vapor in the air has condensed and transformed into droplets on the cold surface of the windshield. This is commonly seen when there is a significant difference in temperature between the air and the windshield. Option (A) is incorrect because the setting sun does not directly cause wet spots on a windshield. Option (C) is unrelated to condensation. Option (D) is also incorrect because windshields are typically made of materials that do not dissolve when exposed to moisture.
